content.user_title: Automate security scanning and vulnerability assessment
content.value_statement: Security operations require consistent assessment and compliance validation across projects. This skill provides automated tools for security scanning, vulnerability assessment, and compliance checking with standardized reporting.
actual_capabilities: Run automated security scans on project codebases using the security scanner script
Perform vulnerability assessments with configurable target paths
Check compliance against security standards with the compliance checker
Generate JSON reports for integration with other tools
Validate target paths before analysis to prevent errors
Enable verbose output for detailed debugging and inspection
limitations: Scripts are template-based with placeholder analysis logic
Does not integrate with external vulnerability databases or threat intelligence feeds
Requires Python 3 to execute scripts locally on your system

use_cases.title: Automated security scans
use_cases.description: Run consistent security scans across multiple codebases with standardized tooling and reporting.

use_cases.title: CI/CD security gates
use_cases.description: Integrate security checks into deployment pipelines with automated JSON report generation.

use_cases.title: Compliance verification
use_cases.description: Verify projects meet security standards and generate audit documentation for review.

prompt_templates.title: Quick security scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a security scan on my project at [project-path] and report any findings.

prompt_templates.title: Vulnerability assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a vulnerability assessment on [target-path] with verbose output. Check for common security issues like injection vulnerabilities, authentication weaknesses, and insecure configurations.

prompt_templates.title: Compliance verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Check my project at [project-path] for compliance with security standards. Generate a detailed report of any compliance gaps.

prompt_templates.title: Full security audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a complete security audit of [target-path] using all three secops tools. Run security scanner, vulnerability assessor, and compliance checker. Generate a combined report with all findings prioritized by severity.

output_examples.input: Run a security scan on my project at ./src
output: Findings: Review the output for any detected issues

output_examples.input: Check my project for compliance with security standards
Perform vulnerability assessment on ./lib with verbose output
output: Detailed findings available in verbose mode

best_practices: Always validate target paths before running scans to prevent accidental analysis of wrong directories.
Use JSON output format with --json flag for integration with other tools and automated CI/CD workflows.
Combine all three secops tools (scanner, assessor, compliance checker) for comprehensive security coverage.
anti_patterns: Running security scans without understanding what the tool actually analyzes or its current capabilities.
Ignoring findings because the scripts contain placeholder logic that needs customization for your environment.
Assuming automated tools replace the need for manual security review and penetration testing.

faq.question: What programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill provides general security scanning templates. Actual language-specific analysis requires implementing logic in the Python scripts.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with vulnerability databases?
faq.answer: No, the current implementation is a template framework. Integration with databases like NVD would require custom implementation.

faq.question: Can I run these scripts in CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, use the --json flag to output machine-readable results suitable for pipeline integration and automated gates.

faq.question: Is my code or data sent to external services?
faq.answer: No, all analysis runs locally on your machine. Scripts do not make network requests or transmit data externally.

faq.question: What should I do when security findings are reported?
faq.answer: Review findings manually, validate them in context, prioritize by severity, and implement appropriate remediation steps.

faq.question: How does this compare to commercial security scanning tools?
faq.answer: This provides a framework for security automation. Commercial tools offer deeper analysis, larger vulnerability databases, and additional features.
